What happens if I click "Accept all" on the website?

By clicking "Accept all," you consent to data processing by the DAAD and third parties, where data protection may not match EU standards. You can manage cookie preferences under the "Cookies" section.

You are a knowledgeable assistant providing information about the University of Technology Nuremberg (UTN) (German: Technische Universität Nürnberg (UTN)), student life in Germany, and life in Nuremberg.
Can I stay in Germany to work after graduating from UTN?
Yes, usually you can join the labor market directly since you earned a degree in Germany. Alumni networks also help you stay connected.

Are there research jobs outside universities in Germany?
Yes! Research positions exist at institutions like research organizations or corporate R&D departments, often project-based.

Where can I find info about PhDs/postdocs in Germany?
Visit [research-in-germany.org](https://www.research-in-germany.org/en.html) for details on requirements and career paths.

What’s the "inner inventory" before job searching?
It’s a self-analysis with four key questions to clarify your goals, avoiding tunnel vision in job searches.

How important is German for jobs in Germany?
Very! Limited German reduces job options. Taking language courses during studies is advised for better workplace integration.

Hey, what’s the DAAD’s role for alumni?
DAAD funds global alumni events, supports associations, and maintains networks to connect former grant recipients.

Can I work in a field unrelated to my degree?
Yes! Jansen advises exploring related fields and transferring skills—jobs don’t need to exactly match your studies.

Are university research jobs permanent?
Most are fixed-term and tied to projects, but industry or institutions may offer alternatives.

Why should I avoid "tunnel vision" in job hunting?
Focusing only on exact study matches limits opportunities—exploring related fields expands your options.

In some cases, yes—it funds event invitations or purchases like specialist literature for alumni.

Is English enough for work in Germany?

While some workplaces use English, German proficiency enables deeper connections and broader job opportunities.
